hero-text.text: CMO.com gets a lovely new mobile experience.

hero-summary.text: On the legs of Adobe Experience Manager and Digital Publishing suite, its a winner, and oh... its only the beginning :)

text.text: In a fuzzy and frenetic age of media disruption, sub-compact publishing, and post-industrial journalism, one thing is clear: our relationship to the news is fundamentally and forever changed. But it is precisely because our world is now so connected—and we are now so empowered by the internet to move from passive consumption to active participation in a global conversation—that staying on top of and engaged with the news is all the more essential. This is true for everyone, from the general public to economic citizens and business leaders, but for these two latter groups, the decisions they make at work and within their portfolios everyday rely on sound business journalism. In a fuzzy and frenetic age of media disruption, sub-compact publishing, and post-industrial journalism, one thing is clear: our relationship to the news is fundamentally and forever changed. But it is precisely because our world is now so connected—and we are now so empowered by the internet to move from passive consumption to active participation in a global conversation—that staying on top of and engaged with the news is all the more essential. This is true for everyone, from the general public to economic citizens and business leaders, but for these two latter groups, the decisions they make at work and within their portfolios everyday rely on sound business journalism.

Journalism, one thing is clear: our relationship to “the news” is fundamentally and forever changed. But it is precisely because our world is now so connected—and we are now so empowered by the internet to move from passive consumption to active participation in a global conversation—that staying on top of and engaged with the news is all the more essential. This is true for everyone, from the general public to economic citizens and business leaders, but for these two latter groups, the decisions they make at work and within their portfolios everyday rely on sound business journalism. In a fuzzy and frenetic age of media disruption, sub-compact publishing, and post-industrial journalism, one thing is clear: our relationship to the news is fundamentally and forever changed. But it is precisely because our world is now so connected—and we are now so empowered by the internet to move from passive consumption to active participation in a global conversation—that staying on top of and engaged with the news is all the more essential. This is true for everyone, from the general public to economic citizens and business leaders, but for these two latter groups, the decisions they make at work and within their portfolios everyday rely on sound business journalism.

description.text: Mobile friendly app, build for iOS and Android (coming)
